conclusion: To find the horizontal distance s traveled by the motorcycle from the platform to point A, we need to consider the motion of the motorcycle during the stunt.
The vertical displacement h is 0.8 m because the motorcycle starts and ends at the same height of 0.8 m.
The vertical displacement h can be related to the time of flight t using the equation h = (1/2) g t^2.
Substituting h = 0.8 m and g = 10 m/s^2 into the equation h = (1/2) g t^2 gives 0.8 = 5t^2.
Taking the square root of t^2 = 0.16 gives t = 0.4 s.
The horizontal distance s can be calculated using the equation s = v × t, where v is the horizontal velocity.
Substituting v = 3 m/s and t = 0.4 s into the equation s = v × t gives s = 1.2 m.
The horizontal distance s traveled by the motorcycle from the platform to point A is 1.2 m.
